intro: Jussiaea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed jussiaea, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Jussiaea stenophylla is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize wetland soils.
